Posted: October 6, 2015
												Never played this game but steam say that I actually did so instead of judging the game here's a cool way to make skinny guacamoles with homemade baked tortilla chips :Skinny Guacamole:2 medium green sweet peppers2 medium fresh poblano chile peppers1 bulb garlic1/2 teaspoon olive oil2 roma tomatoes, seeded and chopped1 serrano pepper, minced2 medium ripe avocados, halved, seeded, peeled, and diced1 teaspoon lime zest2 tablespoons lime juice1/2 teaspoon saltBaked Tortilla Chips:Corn tortillasOlive oil spraySaltFor the guacamole:Preheat oven to 425° F. Line a 15 x 10 x 1-inch baking pan with foil; set aside. Quarter, stem, and seed the peppers. Place pepper quarters, cut sides down, in the prepared pan. Cut off the top half inch of the garlic bulb to expose ends of individual cloves. Leaving garlic bulb whole, remove any loose, papery outer layers. Place bulb, cut end up, on a double thickness of foil. Drizzle with the oil. Bring foil up around bulb and fold edges together to loosely enclose. Place foil packet on the pan with the peppers.Roast peppers and garlic for 20 to 30 minutes or until pepper skins are charred and garlic cloves feel soft. Allow to cool about 15 minutes. When garlic head is cool enough to handle, squeeze garlic paste out of the individual cloves.In a food processor combine roasted pepper quarters and the garlic paste. Cover and pulse until combined, but still slightly chunky.In a large bowl, combine tomatoes and serrano pepper. Add roasted pepper and garlic combination and stir to combine. Add diced avocado, lime zest, lime juice, and salt. Gently toss to combine.Serve immediately or cover the surface with plastic wrap and chill for up to 1 hour.For the chips:Cut corn tortillas into wedges and place on a foil-lined baking sheet. Spray lightly with olive oil spray and season with salt, to taste.Bake in a 350° F oven for 8-10 minutes or until lightly golden brown.

content:
Posted: June 10, 2015
												I have played FPS games for many years, and still belong to an online clan, and we have a lot of fun.This game is good to a degree, but that is where it stops.If you know Gameforge you will know they own Tera the MMO a game that is amazing, but they decided to just screw the whole game up IMO they should have left it as it was , they also do loads of mobile games, so alot of there money comes from that also.Sadly it is the same with this it is a huge money making machine.Dont get me wrong companies have to make money we all know that, but it's the way it is done.lets shorten this OK, so pro's first.Pro's: 1) Very much like C,O.D. 2) Maps are not huge which is nice, so a real good run, and gun.3) Have your TDM, explosive, also Hero which is an alien type, and manhunt, also party for funshoot the glass and c who wins :).Sniper mode is in ther e as well, as is HC to a degree.4) Nice selection of guns, all with different sounds.5)good graphics, and fluid gameplay.Cons:1) You have to repair your guns which cost you ingame money, or you can pay £10 for 30days, and they will give you 2 nice chrome ones which you dont have to repair, but all others you buy you will have to repair :(.2) Camo you have to buy with real money, parts of uniforms again will cost you real money.It so SAD, as most of the stuff only last for 1day, 7 days, or 30 days.3) If you want to be a woman it will cost you nearly £50, and outfit called Black mamba.Gameforge should be done for being sexist, just for this.4)There are only two HC maps in the game, and I love playing HC, so this is a real let down, all maps should have been HC, it's a pain trying to kill someone witth a whole clip sometimes in soft core mode.5) Smoke grenade will cost you 2000 sp (ingame money) or pay with real money which will cost you £5 !!!!, flame grenade's are the same as well.6)The killcam is way off, and they should fix it, as most times it looks, as tho they have not hit you.7) bullet penetration has not been done well at all, fire at someone, and chances are he will turn, and just kill you, as tho you have not hit him at all.8) in COD you can play around with sights atc on the guns, but in this you cannot.If a gun comes with a sight you are stuck with it.9) There does not seem to be any mode for guns like single fire, and full like in COD.10) Info given on guns is useless just give damage accuracy, but would be nice of them to let us know about auto snipersetc.There is a load more wrong with this game not just the money machine.All I can say is try it for a while, and make your own mind up.I paid £10 for a month just to see the differnce between F2P, and P2W.It seems that if you pay all your weapons get + 5% more firepower, and -5% recoil which does make a differnce, and in my book is wrong of the company to do this.

Posted: September 9, 2016
												Before reading this review please check that I do have 2k hours playing it.This game suffers a lot from their publisher, Gameforge. As it is they milk their community as they can.Every month Cash only weapons are added to the lotery ( capsules) which are significantly better than the "free" (ingame currency) versions.These are capsules that used to have a 100 capsules accumulation limit. Once you spent about 50 euros (!) you were sure that that weapon would be yours. Now they remove it - you can actually spend hundreds of euros without having a item that you want.They charge you 75 euros for a +100% exp char 25 euros for a lucky point Tshirt or zombie mask to help you getting extra exp to level up. Yes your heard right.One could think that with all that money they would have a good game. But no.The sheer amount of hackers is insane. I did last week clanwars (cw's) where i couldnt find another clan without hacks. Many have their cheats hidden and once they start loosing the war they start killing you from their spawn or behind walls.The cheating sites actually have happyhours for this game where they offer the cheats for free for the weekend.Why?Because gameforge insist on using Xigncode who anyone in this community know is a very bad anticheat. They also refused to implement VAC as their anticheat,even tho XIGNCODE is beeing replaced everywhere in any game due to be so easy to bypass.Everytime they make a maintenance no one knows when the servers will be back up - that's how competents and professionals they are.10/10 Is beeing runned by money hungry people with absolut no respect for their gaming community.

content:
Posted: May 20, 2015
												I'll go over the advertising to clarify:>>Over 20 maps covering a wide range of locales, spanning everything from deserts through to winter landscapes. True, but every one of these maps is tiny and you'll spawn facing the enemy team, so most of the time, you'll live 10 seconds at best. The map design is by far the worst point of this garbage game.>>Cool weapons to suit every playing style – from pistols through to heavy machine guns. If it weren't for the terrible gun handling, that might be interesting. But the game is mostly spray & pray.>>A plethora of options to change the appearance of your character and weapons. If you got a bucket load of money, that is. Also, items directly influence combat and 75%  of the store has a premium sign.What they don't tell you is:a) horribly outdated graphics. UE3 can do much better.b) really bad client. You'll get popups asking yes or no without knowing what for, the menu is cluttered and it will pop in and out as it sees fitting.c) ZERO feedback. Could be a grenade, could be a giraffe, you don't get a difference. Also, people will gun you down randomly while sprinting because bullets just find their own way of travelling, no need for ballistic physics.If you really MUST play this, just use the pile of credits you get from the start, buy the M14 and shoot people straight, you can get 3-4 kills in a row just spamming the trigger. After than, you're not getting much credits so at least this 30 minutes will be fun.I have now seen the "unique hero mode". It's a blunt and trashy MOBA mode with so many problems a list wouldn't even fit in here. The number one issue in MOBAs are people leaving. Actual MOBA games tackle this issue with massive punishments for leaving. This game offers premium to prevent this punishment. Nuff said.

												Skill SF2 is a P2A (Pay to Aim) FPS game which is also full of hackers and tocix players (like in any other FPS game).Most hackers will claim they are ESL players and most Clans in-game are filled with any kind of hack. Anti-hack shield is a joke which will most likely detect your TS client as a forbidden program and shut down the game, maybe block the game from starting again. (True story, i had to contact the Korean team that developed the shield and get no result of course!). It is not a game to play and have fun with random people, BUT it is a game to play and have fun with friends! You don't have to pay to play it...you just pay to aim or tog et EXP - SP faster. Overall it is another Gameforge game (surprised it is still online), that has close to no possibility of evolving and the swarms of hackers will continue to pollute the game for at least 10 more years, until the game goes offline or changes "hands".P.S. Don't count my hours on steam for this game. I was a Closed Beta player (August 2013), spent way too much time in game creating new accounts to play on the low levels cause on high levels everything was "instant". Too bad steam does not allow you to create multi accounts in Skill :(

content:
Posted: June 17, 2016
												All in all a decent FPS - 7/10If you're looking for a F2P FPS, definitely consider giving this game a go.At first I thought it was another one of those CrossFire/Combat Arms games; you know the ones, where you pay a stupid amount of money to RENT a gun for like 3 days? This IS one of those games - there is gun renting, HOWEVER.The prices for permanent weapons or accesories are very very reasonable. As soon as you start playing, you'll have enough (30 000) SP (game currency, not real money) to buy a permanent weapon and should be able to scrap enough for another by the time you reach 6. Most weapons are between 15 000 to 30 000. I, personally, got an MG, for the insane ROF and DMG, and surprisingly low recoil. Well, that and I absolutely love to see people cry over the MG every single time you kill them.I have no problems with the graphics (even though the menu is sort of low quality). I remember camping in this small shed, covering this teammate who was sniping. I was looking in his direction, standing by him, when all of a sudden his head blows up, covering my screen completely with blood for 5 seconds or so. Instantly contracted PTSD. This is, of course, praising and not scolding.Every day or so, you can get a free item (pick 1 card out of 3, get a random item that increases your stats such as speed, armor or even cash gained) for anything between 24 hours to 7 days.I was surprised by the amount of Game Modes the game has. Other than the classic TDM, S&D, FFA and Domination Game Modes, there's the Hero one (basically a MOBA, pretty unique but didn't really get the hang of it), Convoy (basically Payload (with a twist?)), PvE Zombie Survival, Manhunt (one side weird mutants, other soldiers), good old Hardcore, the fun-packed Party and many more.Is it a P2W? Well, not really.You can become a VIP for 30 days for 99 Cash (another IG currency, 60 Cash is 5 dollars...), which lets you get SP and EXP much faster (though you can just buy boosts for less Cash), 2 chrome skin weapons with 5% more fire power, and 5% less recoil, and instant respawning. You be the judge if that's P2W, obviously is not for me. You can also buy other skins for Cash (roughly 35 Cash for 30 days of.. skin time?), which are purely cosmetic and do not give you any advantages over other non-skin players and characters which give you more EXP and SP while playing with them, ranging anywhere between 49 and even 999 Cash!tl;drPROS  fun gunplay decent graphics rather cheap permanent weapons loads of game modes F2P, not P2W barely any hackers has a (good?) tutorial and a map where you can spawn your own bots rookie servers where you can play with other beginners, though not for long as you can only stay there as long as your K/D is under 1.2, or until you're Sergeant Major (20+ Rank)CONS  every time I launch the game, I must rush into the tutorial or a normal game, because my FPS launches up into a thousand, despite having V-Sync on. Entering a game fixes it really weird low-quality menu, despite the game looking decent gun and accessory rentingWill update if I come across anything else I like/dislike about the game.

content:
Posted: February 4, 2016
												S.K.I.L.L. - Special Force 2Rate: 5/10Pretty good game with a solid gameplay and alot of guns. The maps are great and for sniper lovers it's good.Now why do I give a even rate for this game despite it's great potential.This is f2p game and as we know, when a game is consider a f2p it needs some kind of store or real money strategy to actually gain some income. So as I suspected and my knowledge from previous f2p FPS games, this game includes a store for purchasing weapons and skins. But there is one thing that ruins this game, for me at least, S.K.I.L.L. has a VIP system that is based on a leveling process that when you buy VIP, everyday you will get points depending on the duration of your VIP and then your VIP level will increase and will decrease when you don't have VIP.Now you say well thats great, you get stuff unlocked from the store that is VIP restricted and also some pretty usefull bonuses. Well thats what makes this game fall in to the p2w category. The bonus you get from the VIP are bonus damage and recoil reduction, I believe it around 5% at least at level 1 VIP. The weapons are stronger than the normal weapons, the ones you buy with SP and VIP weapons don't need to be repaired.Also you don't get SP(in-game money) for every match that you win or lose, you will get a small percentage to fill up a bar and when it reaches to 100% it will give you a set amount of SP, but by the time you get another 100% you need to repair your weapons and reaparing weapons is really expensive, so basically you are stuck with low SP for a long time. So my advise is to at least give it a try and if you have money to spare and waste in this game, go on you will get a pretty decent content with VIP. Overall this game is p2w and for me it's a NO.

												I know most MMOFPS are pay 2 win, and I've played lots of them, but only in this game that p2w factor made me quit after 2 hours of playing. The game itself has amazing graphics, the controls feel good, etc...The thing that made me quit is, other games are p2w, but you don't feel that $$ only weapons are that overpowered, it's still manageable to win vs a guy that has $$ items using regular in-game money items. But what happened to me in all, and I repeat, all, the matches over this time is that my UMP and my M4 that I bought with my in game money, took 20/30 bullets to kill a guy, hitting his chest, then I die, check the killcam, and see a fancy gun, that can only be bought for cash, kill me with 5 shots to my feet. This repeats, all over again, with minor variations. It got so ridiculous to the point where a enemy is afk on spawn, I let this spawnprotection expire, aim at his head, fire 15 bullets, get hitmarkers in all, and he still stands alive. Overall, this game would be strongly recommended if it wasn't for this so heavy p2w factor, but still, if you are a kid that wants graphics in a game, and doesn't mid getting♥♥♥♥♥♥♥hard by a bunch of guys that paid for a fancy weapon, this is the game for you!

content:
Posted: May 23, 2015
												First of all, I have played this game since the beta (about 1k hours in total) so ignore my steam hours.This game is really good for a free FPS, it's really fast paced and lots of fun.I started playing this after my AVA career which lasted for 3 or 4 years, until the game died completely. This game was a lot different so it took some time to learn all the tricks and stuff like that, but once I kinda learned how to play it, it became so much fun. This game has all the game modes you need for a FPS game; Team Deathmatch, Free-For-All, Demolition/Blasting (Plant bomb/Defuse bomb) and couple of others like Snowball fight, Hexa (Fighting in a glass arena) and Seizure, which is basically Capture the Flag.I personally don't play too much TDM, FFA or Seizure, or any other ''casual'' game modes, I mainly focus on the Blasting because it's played on the tournaments and is the most competitive mode.TDM is good tho, for training aim and such.Seizure is just some casual fun.FFA is same thing as TDM, but without a team.Weapons in this game are pretty balanced, but there is some exceptions. Some of the SMGs are really trash, you can't do anything with their short range and bad accuracy.All rifles are usable, but there are few rifles picked up by the pros that are considered the best ones in the game (When I was playing this game in ESL tournaments, the best rifles were HK417, M4A1, K2 and Famas).Snipers are really powerful in this game, there are few snipers in the game, but only 3 of them are used by the pros, CheyTac M200, AWP and CZ 700. These are all bolt action snipers, and the semi-autos are pretty useless.This game also has a capsule shop, where you can try to win some overpowered guns with real money. They are pretty good in public games, and casual players seem to fancy them for their good accuracy and damage. But they are banned in the ESL league, so if you want to be good in this game, just don't bother trying to win those guns and learn to use the basic weapons.Community in this game is pretty much the same as in every other FPS game. There are some annoying people and some really great people. You will get called a noob/hacker/cheater/macro/lucker countless times in public games, so just deal with it. In the competitive scene players are respectful and really cool guys in general, so if you can't handle the kids in public games, create a team and start scrimming with other teams.And for those who want to join the competitive scene, ESL is hosting GO4Skill cup every weekend. So just pull together a team, and join.Overall I would give this game a 9/10, it is a really good free FPS game, and has potential to become really big.Had a lot fun in tournaments, so thanks for that to everyone in the scene.

I then proceded to get one-shot multiple times from a sniper rifle with some of them shooting two feet behind me and hitting but ended up winning with a positive K/D ratio feeling rather disappointed and decided to try a different game mode. I would not recommend playing this unless you are absolutly bored and have nothing better to do.

Posted: May 19, 2015
												Nice remake of Soldier Front (it's the same DragonFly series)The game isn't really " Pay to win "It still requires 'skill' to get kills. Tho some paid stuff (tomahawk, hammers) can be useful sometimes.You can compare the game the most with "Soldier Front 2" from Aeriagames.The big difference with these other versions is the support. GameForge has enough staff to keep this game up to date, respond to your tickets in less than 24 hours etc.GameForge also updates the game on regular basis: meaning new maps, modes, guns etc.This makes the game more dynamic than eg. CoD.Even tho it's a F2P game and there are many things you can buy in-game, GameForge tries to keep the game reasonable for non-paying users. By leveling up and unlocking achievements you earn enough in-game money to buy you a nice arsenal of guns.For more screenshots / gamemodes / guns / info visit https://skill.gameforge.comYou'll also find the GameForge launcher there## DOWNLOADING THE GAMEBenefits of downloading the game via steam+ faster than via GF servers+ automatic updates (if enabled in your client)+ steam in-game overlay so you can browse facebook/google stuff while you're dead ;)Downside of downloading the game via steam- you can't (yet) login to your GameForge accountps: I've played both SF1, SF2 and SKILL. I have a couple thousand hours on record.

Posted: August 5, 2015
												I've been playing this game for quite some time now (I used to play it before it was on steam). Although the game has its disadvantages, it still truly is a remarkable FREE to play game. I capitalise 'FREE' because everyone expects the game to be 100% perfect. The 'Hero Mode' pretty much makes the game. It's really fun to play with a coordinated team. It's pretty much League of Legends but in first person... and with pimp guns!Q: Are there hackers in the game:A: Yes there are hackers BUT they're not frequent. Everyone is friendly and contributes to the ban/kick of the hacker. Q: Is this game Pay2Win?A: Although many people claim it is Pay2Win, It really isn't haha. Every 'paid' weapon is exactly the same as every normal weapon except it may have a shiny texture e.g. Gold or Chrome. These guns don't have any advantage over the normal ones. They are simply there for 'bling'. Character models may give you an XP and SP increase but you get what you pay for, right?. Pay2Win Level: 2/10. (I give it a two only because I like the cool looking guns and wish I had them)One problem that annoys me: It's quite hard to find people who talk english. If you talk english or understand feel free to add me in-game (AlmightyPear). I'm assembling a team.Note: Don't play this game for like 2-5 hours and start complaining. Practice is needed.

It's pretty bare bones.Cons: really made me question if I wanted to recommend this game, but it's got the stupid typical korean p2w crap attached to it. The VIP is just...idk how to word it without just saying it's the stupidest ****. VIP gives you camos which increase your weapon damage and reduce recoil by 5%. But that's not all! it also allows you to spawn instantly...like really? Then this games got a super low population and they're gonna have this VIP crap in their game...their game may have been dying prior to this, but sure as hell adding the VIP crap isn't gonna make people wanna stay it's gonna kill your game that much faster. Two other lesser cons is there's a big lack of customization, not a lot of weapon choices, and I was really hoping for the cool cat gun I saw on youtube. Then lastly which also is a bit of a fun killer...some weapons are way over tuned. I've been using the...m16 I believe. 1 burst kills most I think that's a little redic. random tip: play on the EU. US is completely dead.Edit: at the moment it would seem the EU servers either got merged with the US or just got shut down. Any time I attempt login via EU it says the game isn't available in my region. I thought maybe a region lock was placed, but wouldn't let me on even with a VPN.

content:
Posted: August 12, 2015
												With a couple of exceptions, Gameforge's games line-up is all about fantasy titles, however the publisher took a distance from their usual environment by offering you a brutal and competitive military-themed online FPS: S.K.I.L.L.S. - Special Force 2. With a lot of well established free MMOFPS out there, offering something capable to stand out and gather a consistent pool of players is certainly a tough challenge; and of course we couldn't miss the chance to see what Gameforge managed to do in a field that for them is totally new and unexplored, so follow us in this review and check out if the game is worth trying or not!The first impression upon entering into the game is somewhat both good and bad. It is good because everything is kind of familiar if you've ever played any other f2p MMOFPS, and you will basically know how to play and navigate in the different menus, but at the same time you will probably feel a sense of déjà vu as the developers' intention clearly wasn't to innovate or change the genre, but to offer their personal interpretation of a well-known and working formula. Speaking about menus, after the log-in you will be brought to a pretty standard home screen containing all the classic tabs that you would expect from a game like this: capsule market, shop, inventory, mini-game, career and clan. While shop, inventory and clan are pretty much self explanatory, the others may need a word or two about them. The capsule market is a place where you can buy different kinds of sealed boxes which contain a random item and give you the chance to obtain special and unique gear pieces. However, most of them are temporary, and you could end up with an item that you don't need at all, so choose wisely if it's worth to gamble or not. Regarding the mini-game tab, don't be too excited; the game offers some interesting and unique game modes, but in this tab the only thing you will find is only a free training mode where you can spawn dummies and do other stuff in order to get confident with controls and mechanics. In the career tab you can find all the information and statistics about your in-game performance and more. The game features a shop that offers a wide selection of digital reproductions of real firearms, which are usually available for both cash and in-game currency. Of course there are unique VIP weapons which are only available to VIP players, but from what I could see the differences are mainly cosmetic and intended to let you show off your VIP status. One thing that I appreciated a lot is the possibility to buy permanent weapons. They still need to be repaired, but this is a whole different thing compared to a lot of other free MMOFPS where you can only buy temporary weapons and you are forced to constantly play the game in order to buy them again when they expire. With this system, on the other hand, you can buy a new weapon, take a break from the game for some time and then come back without the fear of having wasted your precious weapon. The control system is standard and identical to almost every other modern FPS. However, I have to say that the jump feels a little strange. There are a lot of objects in the arena that seems to be there just to be climbed and that are not very tall, but you can't actually jump on them. As I said it's a little strange and sometimes kind of frustrating, but it is absolutely not a game-breaker. However, the point where the S.K.I.L.L . - Special Force 2 gameplay tries to differentiate itself from the masses, is probably the featured game modes: Deathmatch,Team Deathmatch, Seizure, Escape, Blasting, Manhunt, Glass, Hero, Sniper battle...there's a lot of them.Speaking about graphics, S.K.I.L.L. feels like a raw gem; they are not bad, instead, they are actually pretty good, but they just can't stand comparison with the latest free-to-play online FPS. S.K.I.L.L.'s graphics, while clean and enjoyable, lack in details and this makes the maps' design to look a little empty and too simple. The same deal goes with the sounds; they are not bad, but I think that the developers could have made a way better job with just a little more effort. The steps sounds are often a little unnatural, while the shooting and weapons sounds are average.S.K.I.L.L. - Special Force 2 is a valid free-to-play shooter which puts a lot of emphasis on community and clans. Even if it's not the best shooter around regarding graphics and sounds, it manages to offer a complete and fun overall gameplay experience and some pretty unique and fun game modes.

content:
Posted: March 23
												All those comments about pay 2 win? They're not joking.TL;DR: Don't play unless you want to sink money into the game.I loved the fast paced environment and it felt pretty satisfying to kill people... provided they hadn't bought a gun better and get you first.  I played Seize first, and that was pretty fun although I'm not a fan of round based gamemodes. I leveled up twice and was super pumped to see the little amount of "SP" I won. I was disappointed to go back to the lobby and see I got nothing. What??? I understand most free to play games are not very generous to non-VIP/pay-to-get-a-membership but usually you get something. Okay...I tried the AI-bot gamemode next, that was awesome. Being able to get multiple double kills - SWEET! However, it wasn't hard because the map was basically a hall way and you could really only funnel out of one area making spawn killing just way too easy and unfair. Again. out of the lobby... I did get a little option to pick something. However, it was only an item you get for X amount of days. Boring. Again, no SP. Since the game mostly revolves around SP and having an INSANE amount for benefits (10,000+) or buying cash for cool items, I don't really want to continue playing when I can only play two gamemodes (the rest didn't have anyone playing, probably for this reason). Disappointing, but not the worst game in the world. You're better off to sink money into something more rewarding, in my opinion.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2015
												It is free to play but not pay to win, and that automatically makes the game so much better than any others that indirectly force you to spend money to actually have fun. If you are really keen on spending money, you can buy some capsules that give you some good weapons, or buy V.I.P. to look so 1337 compared to your teammates with a coloured name and background.Beware, as there are hackers in public servers, but these can be kicked out of the game easily. What you'll encounter frequently is players using macros, which do the double-Q motion automatically while using snipers. Please, don't be one of these idiots.Like most games, this is more fun while played with friends. Specially the Hero mode, which is basically League of Legends in first-person perspective with shooter elements and Survival, which is PvE and consists of you and your team surviving waves of monsters. Regarding the Hero mode, I did compare it with LoL, but the thing is: I have played LoL and hated it, the whole MOBA aspect doesn't appeal to me, but playing a strategic MOBA-like game in first person shooter is so fun, and I congratulate the S.K.I.L.L. devs for adding this in.Other game modes: Glass, Seizure (i.e. CTF), Escape, Single (i.e. free-for-all DM), Defense (Survival with difficulties) and Manhunt (kind of like a PvP zombie mode, but against alien-ish creatures). There are also the classic FPS game modes: Team Deathmatch, Sniper - Point Battle (TDM with only snipers) and Blasting (bomb planting/defusing). As you can see, it has tons of game modes to satisfy a wide range of tastes.There's also an active competitive S.K.I.L.L.[play.eslgaming.com] scene, but I can't dwell much into that as I'm not part of it.The graphics are pretty good and you can configure them to your own liking. I don't care much for eye candy in first person shooters so I play in low graphics and get around 300 FPS. Oh, and this game doesn't require you to have a top of the line gaming PC. The recommended specs are 2 GB of RAM, a Core2 Duo E6600 or comparable and GeForce 8600 GT or higher. You can probably even play with a worse PC than that, but seriously, it's the second decade of the 21th century, you should already have a computer that's way more powerful than that. >tl;dr: very good free-to-play FPS. Downsides are some hackers and macro users, upsides are good graphics, gameplay and fun game modes.

content:
Posted: April 12, 2016
												Having played this game for dozens of hours via the Gameforge client, I now feel experienced enough to give you a rough overview over the game.BASICSSKILL is a PvP online shooter though also features several PvE modes; the game covers most standard game modes like Blasting (arming/disarming a bomb), Seizure (stealing an object) and Escape as well as the standard TeamDeathMatch. For those SKILL offers several dozen maps with different layouts, from small arenas like Hangar to slightly more open ones like Russian Factory. It’s worth keeping in mind, however, that the maps in general are not too big, though usually offering multiple paths and a good mix of open and more linear parts. In addition you can participate in some so called party-modes which involve playing in arenas made of breakable glass floors or jumping over obstacles.For everyone interested in coop-focused action there’re PvE modes against aliens and zombies as well as a moba-style mode with spawning alien bots as well as a leveling-up system.TECHNICAL STUFFOn the technical side the game is solid, with nice sound effects and weapon models though overall slightly dated graphics; when being in a tense multiplayer match, you probably won’t notice this too much though. It has to be said, however, that the game suffers from some performance troubles due a not really perfect optimisation which seem to have gotten worse over time. You may also encounter some connection problems from time to time which seem to appear out of nowhere but usually disappear as miraculously as they appeared.And yes, as in most F2P games you will also find hackers here in SKILL. Most of the time their numbers are rather low with the exception of some rare “hacker-waves”. While public matches are mostly fine, they seem to be a more common annoyance in clan matches.CLANS&TOURNAMENTSRegarding clans and eSports in general: The game features a built-in matchmaking system for clans as well as special channels for them, while the public matches are separate. Gameforge recently announced the end of the eSports leagues due to a lack of active players there, though maintaining the so called Go4Skill cup with money prizes as well as sponsoring community-organised tournaments.SHOPOf course you will find a lot of equipment items like hats, gloves, t-shirts etc in the ingame shop as it’s common for F2P games. The basic items are available for the normal currency SP which you can earn, more advanced ones which usually give you a money and experience boost have to be bought with Cash, the premium currency. This includes character skins which completely change your whole appearance as well as boosters, weapon camos etc.Talking about weapon: SKILL features a large amount of non-customizable weapons for every playstyle – all available for SP. You can set-up up to three different loadouts you can switch between during a match, consisting of one main gun, sidearm and special weapon (like throwing axes, bows, …) plus 3 different grenades. There’re, however, a couple of advanced weapons with shinier camos and attachments like better scopes which can only be obtained via the so called capsule market.Here you have to buy capsules with Cash to get a chance of winning one of those special guns. It’s pretty much a luck-based system though even if the capsule doesn’t drop the wanted weapon, you still get another item, camo or some SP.The capsule weapons have a slight stat-boost over their normal brethren, though it’s too small to make any difference in the game. The game still is true to it’s name and very much dependant on SKILL. It has to be said though, that there’re slightly troubling tendencies, with the last update introducing a gun with heavily improved stats for roughly three-times the price of the normal capsules. Let’s hope they don’t continue this road.MISCELLANEOUSIn more or less regular intervals new events are activated in the game. They usually last for only 2 or 3 weeks and aren’t really creative; the prizes are okay and can get you a temporary version of those precious capsule guns or the premium skins.Overall the update policy currently is a little bit weird, with a large break between the last two updates. It also has to be said that most updates only contain new content like maps, weapons, skins etc and only rarely additional features. Looking at the amount of requests and suggestions by the community since the launch in 2013 it seems like the developers are not really interested in adding new features, tweaks or fixing things.The VIP system which basically is some kind of subscription model currently offers a boost to your EXP and SP as well as access to a couple of silver or gold weapons which have the advantage of not having to be repaired. There’re some other, minor extras (special emblems, reduced quick-spawn costs, …) but overall it currently isn’t very attractive thing to invest in except right at the start of the game, where you’re more likely in money-troubles and can use the VIP-system to avoid repair-costs.SUMMARYSKILL definitely isn’t the holy grail of multiplayer shooters though it’s definitely a solid game with which you can have fun for a couple of hours, even more probably in a clan. Fortunately the game so far stayed away from the dark path of P2W, though as mentioned recent changes are troubling, especially combined with the slow updates.If you’re looking for a free, fast and simple PvP shooter or some horde-mode PvE action why not give this game a try – you most probably will spend some fun hours with it, there’re worse alternatives on the market right now ;)For some gameplay, check out my video review: 


YouTube™ Video: F2P Check - SKILL Special Force 2 Review

Posted: July 23, 2016
												Special Force 2 is an easy for everyone FPS game because of it's very familiarformula of navigation and gameplay.This game has a very good feature that i liked the most from other FPS gameswhich wasn't other than the weapon shop buying feature which allow you to buyweapons for permanent use and not for temporary use which sadly forced you to buy them over and over when they expired.The grachics are very well balanced and the gameplay is standard and identical to almostevery other modern FPS.Another positive feature is that it contains a huge selection of game modes (TDM, DM, Survival, Defence, Seizure, Escape, Blasting, Party modes etc).You also have the ability to create-join with clans and experience head to head wars which is very interesting.The only minor thing i personally didn't like about was that some of the maps felt somewhat low detailed or eigher empty as far as enviroment content, but it could be not a big deal since the game has so much to offer for a free-to-play.Overall, SKILL Special Force 2 is clean and enjoyable with unique and fun game modes and it's the right choice for everyone who looks to have fun and also for the people who look for challenge and hardcore gameplay.I'll give it a score of 9/10.

It is free to play and it has good graphics.The good part of this game is that you dont need a good computer to run it, because my one is a i5 with 8gb of RAM (i mean, it is not the best laptop in the world ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)). It has lots and lots of guns and camos. The only bad thing i find is that you have to buy some clothes, for example, the horse face, instead of being able to buy it with SPs. Anyways, it is so entertaining and fun... You can join a clan, get new weapons, level up your rank, play more than 12 different gamemodes. Only one word for this game: MAGIC!Es un juego fantástico! En serio lo recomiendo 100%! Desde el primer momento en el que lo jugué me quede viciadísimo a él. Además, se mejora de forma muy rápida: ha sido el primer FPS al que juego en PC. Recuerdo que al principio era un poco malo, pero ahora la verdad es que no hay nadie que me pare (por lo menos en el servidor de principiantes ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)), y eso que llevo jugando apenas 4 meses. Pero no sólo eso; hay una gran variedad de juegos, personajes, armas, ediciones de armas, clanes y las clásicas cápsulas (como las cajas de CS:GO). Por último, los gráficos son excelentemente buenos para ser de un Free-To-Play, y se puede jugar perfectamente desde un ordenador malo (de 3GB de RAM, por ejemplo).

content:
Posted: May 30, 2015
S.K.I.L.L. - Special Force 2 is a valid free-to-play shooter which puts a lot of emphasis on community and clans. Even if it's not the best shooter around regarding graphics and sounds, it manages to offer a complete and fun overall gameplay experience and some pretty unique and fun game modes. With its simple graphics and solid mechanics, combined with a fair in-game shop and a complete clan system, the game has the right tools to offer a nice competitive scene for hardcore players and an enjoyable environment for new players as well. If you are a fan of online FPS and want to try something new without going too far away from your usual games, S.K.I.L.L. - Special Force 2 could be the right choice.

number of helpful: 13 of 24 people (54%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 13, 2015
												"Enemy helicopter is start ready."In a nutshell, SF2 can be described as 'eh'. I played in closed beta a year or so back, maybe somewhere around 10 hours. I can't seem to link my account to Steam and it's forcing me to make a new character which I do not care to do, so I'm sure as hell not going to be using Steam to play it.Special Force 2 is the EU name for Soldier Front 2, the sequel to a Korean FPS made back in 2005, surprisingly named Soldier Front. SF1 had graphics from 2002 and game mechanics from 1995. Seriously. Creating a movement engine that doesn't allow you to go faster running diagonally was one of the first things I learnt as a hobbyist developer (Don't let anyone tell you Pythagoras' theory and trigonometry isn't useful), yet Soldier Front 1 still has this 'feature' well into 2015. I believe SF1 is on Greenlight in some form, but enough about that.The graphics are fine. Not spectacular, but not an eye-sore. The game tries very hard to be Call of Duty, and you can see it in the aesthetics of the HUD (In places they're not even trying to look different), and the gunplay (run and gun, ADS, all of that, you can't really complain about it, unless it's about how cookie-cutter it is). Game modes are your standard affair. 'Single' is deathmatch. Team Deathmatch is, well, team deathmatch. 'Blasting' is your standard Counterstrike bomb defusal mode. In 'Seizure', one team has to capture an item and bring it back to base, the other defends it. Simple enough. I haven't seen the 'Party' mode before, noted as the 'Glass' gamemode ingame, but it just seems to be a♥♥♥♥♥♥around mode probably taken from CS custom map. The real sore thumb is the 'Hero' mode, an FPS MOBA on some 3-laned alien landscape where you try to advance your load of aliens to the enemy base. Use gold earned from killing blows to buy stats and new guns. Cliche FPS mechanics fitted with cookie-cutter MOBA mechanics. Whatever.Soldier Front 1's store returns here in Special Force 2, where you have to repair guns after each use, stat-boosting armor and equipment are timed items, and the coolest stuff is behind luck-based capsules and other paywalls. Unlike the first game however, it seems (I may be wrong) paywall guns aren't utterly broken. The VIP guns are just gold/chrome reskins, perhaps with a sight or something. If you want to pay for that, enjoy,I guess.I haven't given it the greatest look, but without level up rewards and EXP/SP boosters, I think people would run at a loss trying to maintain all of their guns and other equipment. Admittedly I could make a better effort to save money, but already a few hours in they're not just throwing it out anymore.Maybe I will play it on occassion. Even I like a bit of Call of Duty sometimes. And I guess if you want to play Call of Duty without purchasing the latest games over and over again, this would be it.

												Just your generic Korean free to play and pay to win first person shooter.  Most of these games are better being played in one life game modes instead of team deathmatch. It's an okay game but it can definitely be better but if these developers want to actually want to be relevant, they need to start changing up and bring in new features instead of using the same old feature over and over again.  A lot of these F2P P2W FPS games are dying but it's good though, we got better games like Overwatch and Rainbow Six Siege.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 7, 2016
												Like so many other games its broken in so many sectors... with cheating rampid and lack of ability to report and remove these obvious cheaters is a serious issue.  On top of that the game continues along like every other fps with loads of microtransactions that will give you hugh advantanges against other players in a number of ways.   I find it easier just to start a private room against AI or play the PvE modes.   If you avoid public rooms and play with only friends the game can be quite entertaining, that or have VIP access to remove cheaters quickly without limitations due to not being on a cheaters team or the fact that only 1 report every 24 hours can be made per day even if you run into 10 different cheaters throughout gameplay in a single session.  (Note when I claim cheaters, these are people who can be seen in the kill cam without a weapon in hand at their spawn point killing the other team at their spawn point with nothing but headshots.)All in all, its just like every other FPS with no real change.   Guess the point here is the base engine is so easy to use that any idiot can make this type of FPS and put microtransactions in the game to milk it for as much as you want and ignore the obvious issues that plague FPS shooters.

												Really good game, worth taking a moment to look at. Alot of different modes to chose from and the gameplay somewhat reminds of the famous Call of Duty franchise. content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
												I don't know if this is death cam problem , latency problem or this game doesn't require aiming because 90% of death cams show that person shooting at you was nowhere close to you (especially with sniper rifles).Earning SP in this game is made to make you want spend money. I had to play 4.7h with sp boost to get 3000 sp when new weapon cost ~25000. You don't get sp after each game like in most games you get ~1-3% to your sp bar and you get sp only when it reaches 100% (3k sp).I haven't played that much to be sure but it seems that vip(paid subscription) weapons have more damage and vip payers are harder to kill (not because they are better but because they are more bullet spongey).

content:
Posted: June 14, 2015
												S.K.I.L.LPros.+ Not pay2win+ Good selection of guns+ Great maps with many ranges and perches+ I especially love the special look for different "goverments" (or whatever) we're in.+ Different zooms for gunsCons.- Annoying with the time of puchased weapons and extras until it expires- AWP Phoenix's zoom and time to reload and horrendous.- The amount of ways to get killed is stupid. There's really no place to stop by and reload before going back into battle.- No ups/downs for secondary weapons and such. Only primary weapons.- No shotguns or miniguns?Overall I think S.K.I.L.L has the potention to become one of the best FPS Shooter games. Perhaps as good as CS:GO as you don't have to pay as much to get good guns - never mind the huge price to buy the game itself. Graphics could be improved but it's quite realistic (in a virtual way). I love how there're different zooms for different guns and they've added just about everything but shotguns and miniguns. It would be awesome if you could hit players with guns too for those who don't have time to press f, especially with a slow tomahawk. Very good for a free game.I definitely recommend this to those who wish to have a fair chance and love multiplayer and shooter games. Also those who love sniping others from afar and spraying bullets into people from behind. Lmao.

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 13, 2015
												So what can i tell you about SKILL aka Special Force 2!All i can say is im going to give you my 100% honest opinion about the game so lets start!The game as itself is good,it has many modes to play such as TDM,Search & Destroy,Seizure,Capture,Escape and many many more,i play TDM the most and i play other modes which dont affect your KD while playing it which are most likely modes for pure fun like Alien Modes such as Manhunt,Defense,Survival and Hero which are all of my favorite fun modes in this game!Ive seen a lot of people complaining about the game with Microtransactions allowed in the game and VIP Cards which are not permanent,instead Temporarily which you have to pay for every now and then,I think players and fans of Free to Play games like myself should ignore Microtransactions,Because they are always optional,Still you can buy Permanent Weapons with InGame Currencys or you can choose to buy them with real money aswell as other items and weapons aswell!Now lets talk about the Weapons and the Gameplay itself.The Weapons in this game are cool,Not all of them are the best and some are slow and weak compared to others,For now my favorite are M4,Kalash,HK,P90 and other few i cant remember the names of,As for the pistols my favorite are Jericho and Infinity,I am not a big fan of Snipers,Shotguns nor MG's,As for the gameplay.....The Gameplay in this game is good,Very good actually because it looks a lot like Call of Duty,The gameplay is pure Modern Shooter Run & Gun action and there are lots of ways to kill your enemies except just shooting them in the face :D,Ive been playing this game since last year on Gameforge Live until it released on Steam,Now i decided to give it one more chance!As for the Community i will tell you this,i Honestly hate the community in this game very very much,the SF2 community is very similar to COD community as people like to talk crap and insult other players when somebody owns them,also i have encountered a lot of Cheaters,Aimbots,WallHackers and even Campers in this game so all of this is the reason why im raging so hard in this game each time i play it,So for everyone who is reading this,BEWARE OF THESE FREAKS!!!!So to end this review is it possible for me to recommend this game to other people?Apsolutely!If you are a COD player or a player who likes to play Modern Shooters similar to the COD franchise,you will love this game as much as i did by playing it,With that being said im safe to say i do like the game very much except the Community and unfair players i encountered in the game,Keep in mind that Hit Detection may lag or cause trouble in the game by not hiting your target when you fire your weapon,also let me remind you about this.......People like to Headshot Aimbot in this game a lot too,Im not saying that there is almost every second player in the game who Headshots with Aimbots all the time but trust me i met a lot of these kind of players,I want to let you know that you should be aware about this,most of the times as i have been running around the corner to attack enemy players there have been a lot and i mean A LOT of times as i met another player face to face just to get instantly Headshotted before i even got a chance not to pull the trigger,but even to blink of how fast that happened,This moment as i just explained you in details is what really Pisses me the hell of the MOST and makes me wanna strangle the person that did that to me,Also its very easy to die in this game as Hit Detection is set to kill your victim after you fire few shots to him,but when im getting shot at i die instantly,Sometimes this game acts completely unfair and this is another thing i dont like about this game.....So to end this wall of text i can feel free to tell you that I do like this game very much,Especially the Alien modes,I completely dislike the Community of this game aswell as VIP players as they have way more advantages,damage,speed and more extra stuff as soon as they become VIP players,Also Female Characters in this game are completely impossible to kill as they run way faster than normal speed in the game,they Headshot the most too and are incredibly hard to kill,All in all if you like owning other players in games such as COD and being rewarded for many kills and other actions you perform in this game,This is a perfect game for you and you might like it as much as i did enjoyed playing it myself.Get it,Play it Enjoy it......I know i did!P.S. ignore the Microtransactions :D

content:
Posted: May 20, 2015
												I've played this game before (not on steam) and put some decent hours into it.At the end it's not worth it. Believe me.(Had to play at least 5 minutes on steam to be able to write a review)(I just AFK'd the launcher for 5 minutes because I don't want to play this game ever again in my life)The game actually feels somewhat decent when you play it but it doesn't take long before you are matched against some players with purple shining VIP armor and weapons who are unbelievably bad at the game but still destroy you because they are harder to kill and their guns do more damage. In other words, Pay 2 Win.Also (but like in every game nowadays) cheaters are a problem, it seems like the anti cheat they use is so old or it doesn't even do anything.The competitive side is somewhat okay-ish if you play on ESL. It's not allowed to use VIP items in those matches (afaik) but you will be teamed up with people who are probably going full keen bean mode and will flame you to death if you are not half decent in the game, so have fun with that.Without the pay 2 win VIP items bulshit I would probably recommend this game and rate it even as high as a solid 7/10 for a free shooter. But the P2W just ruins all the fun for people who don't want to throw money at this game.

number of helpful: 7 of 14 people (50%) found this review helpful9 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 27, 2016
												This game has some amazing features.You don't actually need to aim at your enemy to hit him, the bullets will deflect mid-air to guide themselves to your target.Secondly, who needs killcams, right? I mean, they added the killcam feature in yet it laggs more than the average russian on CS:GO.Thirdly, I got rewarded for quitting the game! Seriously though, when I pressed the quit button I got an award for being the 2000th player to login (even though i was logging out). And then it asked if I wanted to go back into the game instead, even though I very consciously pressed the quit button.That's amazing!Would I recommend this game to people that have absolutely nothing to do with their lives, that have no social life whatsoever, live on government welfare and are willing to pay to win for an amazing shooter game? No I wouldn't. Even those people deserve better.Please don't waste your time.Thank you and please come again.

												This game is the best F2P shooter i played.Graphics are one of the best ive seen for a f2p game.the verity of guns and maps it quite big.constent updates(ive played the game for 1.5 years)the community is like in any other game sometimes u meet nice ppl sometimes u meet awful ppl.But i think every1 flames once in a while XDdepends on ur mood like 90% of the ppl i know get mad and trash talk atleast once in a while so overall the comunity is nice .this game has a really big amount of game modes most of the are familiar to most of u who tried playin an fps game b4 but there are some unique game modes like HERO mode witch is a moba style kinda mode really rare mode for fps games.If ur looking to find a group to play in it sreally easy to get into a clan of ur skill lvl and start playin some Clan wars.Clan wars channels are fluded with ppl so its really awesome that u dont need to wait for ages like in other games.The competitive scene is one of the best ive seen in f2p games and its always growing .The devs always listen to what the cumminity has to say .Ive been playin the game for a while now and ive seen the community complains on a few aspects of the game.and sooner or later the devs always managed to find an answer.u can   always join the game forums aswell.http://board.skill.gameforge.com/if u have any questions most of them can be answered hereabout P2W from what i know a gun won in the capsule shop have stats improved by 5% so its nothing that can break the game if u are decent at fps games this game is as easy as it gets aim for the head end of story.So overall best f2p game ive played really worth a try and maybe well even meet :D

content:
Posted: November 7, 2015
												Played this game but steam say that I actually did so instead of judging the game here's a cool way to make skinny guacamoles with homemade baked tortilla chips :Skinny Guacamole:2 medium green sweet peppers2 medium fresh poblano chile peppers1 bulb garlic1/2 teaspoon olive oil2 roma tomatoes, seeded and chopped1 serrano pepper, minced2 medium ripe avocados, halved, seeded, peeled, and diced1 teaspoon lime zest2 tablespoons lime juice1/2 teaspoon saltBaked Tortilla Chips:Corn tortillasOlive oil spraySaltFor the guacamole:Preheat oven to 425° F. Line a 15 x 10 x 1-inch baking pan with foil; set aside. Quarter, stem, and seed the peppers. Place pepper quarters, cut sides down, in the prepared pan. Cut off the top half inch of the garlic bulb to expose ends of individual cloves. Leaving garlic bulb whole, remove any loose, papery outer layers. Place bulb, cut end up, on a double thickness of foil. Drizzle with the oil. Bring foil up around bulb and fold edges together to loosely enclose. Place foil packet on the pan with the peppers.Roast peppers and garlic for 20 to 30 minutes or until pepper skins are charred and garlic cloves feel soft. Allow to cool about 15 minutes. When garlic head is cool enough to handle, squeeze garlic paste out of the individual cloves.In a food processor combine roasted pepper quarters and the garlic paste. Cover and pulse until combined, but still slightly chunky.In a large bowl, combine tomatoes and serrano pepper. Add roasted pepper and garlic combination and stir to combine. Add diced avocado, lime zest, lime juice, and salt. Gently toss to combine.Serve immediately or cover the surface with plastic wrap and chill for up to 1 hour.For the chips:Cut corn tortillas into wedges and place on a foil-lined baking sheet. Spray lightly with olive oil spray and season with salt, to taste.Bake in a 350° F oven for 8-10 minutes or until lightly golden brown.

content:
Posted: July 30, 2015
												My opinion:This game is a 5/10This game is exciting and very fun to play at times, however one needs a full wallet to be the best. I like to call this ' may the richest player win '. This is because there are many micro transactions (in game purchases) that to buy them all you would have to be a millionaire, there are that many that this game is forced to be under the pay-to-win section. This is because people with the real money payed guns will destroy ones without. Another fault in this game is that when me and my friend ( ' Lord Commander Jon Snow ' ) were playing a game (ask him if this you don't believe) we found a hacker. and what really annoyed me was the person had aimbot. The thing is, this person was absolutely terrible at using this aimbot, luckily, however there needs to be more secure servers.On another note, this game was quite addicting and fun to play at times, with good gameplay and decent maps. the guns are quite good too.There was another problem too. Unbalanced as hell.Get the £500 guns vs free guns, one shot kill.Although they are paying for the guns, there needs to be some balancing involved.I do put my textures low for maximum framerate, however the textures do need upgrading. The snow looks like a big sheet of white cardboard on the floor.overall - bad -1. Unbalanced2. Pay-to-win3. Hackers4. Texturesgood -1. Nice maps2. Good guns3. Good gameplayIn this review there are more negatives (major negatives) than there are positives (major positives), therefore this review is going to be negative, however I still believe the game is worth a try :) Thanks -Will

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 25, 2015
												Ok to start off I downloaded thsi game for free I believe it is still counted as the infamour free to pay pay to win genere of games.This game has many bits people will like, many guns you can buy, equipment grenades etc. The game feels good controls wise. It has capture, bombing, man hunt TDM and Dm Game modes.Man hunt is interesting because one team is an ALien threat attacking earth (Only 2 maps you can play on) and the other is the earth defence force.Ths sounds fun playing as Earth Defence force alsa at the start of the game unliek say CS:GO or Tactical intervention you dont get a selection of between 5 and 12 weapons. You start off woth an m16 a hand gun and..... thats it. I had to buy an m60 Machine gun and a incendiary grenade using SP points liek Tactical interventions XP points but you need 25,000 for a hand gun 30,000 for a shotgun 25,000 for armour.... and each match you only get 500 sp.... if you win.And teh kick system is awful. If I play tactical intervention and soemone is being a prat t killing afk'ing whatever I can push f3 and choose kick that person for free.... IKR crazy idea its free you are restricted but Tactical Intervention does a good job with allowing people to police it.Skill is a joke because it costs you 300 sp to vote kick someone.... not even kicking them just the vote costs you 300 sp.This game has no story So dont go looking for one.People can sometimes be incredibly easy to kill other times incredibly difficult. The kill actions are basic ragdoll physics but unlike Tactical intervention people dont explode. There are no vehicles except for convoy where a trck full of bullion goes at less than a granny on zimmerframe speed and guess what you have to protect it....This is the most blatant example of free to  play but pay to win. I cannot recoommen this. If you want a free game go see Tactical Intervention for a giggle they give you a choice pay 12,000 xp for a hand gun or pay £1.75 say for it. You can even rent on Tactical intervention. I prefer games to be up front with what things cost.

content:
Posted: September 18, 2015
												This is one of the most pay to win games I've ever seen, actually make that THE most pay to win game I've ever seen.spending real money in the game gives you:-More damage-Less recoil-More resitance (armor)-More in-game money (this one is kind of a given)-The ability to purchase scopes and other attachements (A normal player CAN'T buy any sights, supressors or laser sights)As a non payer player, you'll have to grind A LOT, to get any weapons, and the best thing of all is  that you have to repair your weapon from time to time as it gets damaged from being used, wich is the best way of spending your hard gained money, in the past 5 day.On top of that there is NO INGAME REPORT SYSTEM, so you can flame and hack to your hearts content as you are very likely to not be caught. Although it has some fun mods, they don't compensate for the Pay to Win factor of the game (And the sexist one, as in order to be a women you have to pay €50 and it's sexuality)If you want to play the kind that as objective based gameplay, buy CS:GO, if you want to play in more closed maps play CoD (in fact CoD maps have much more verticality and alterbative routes that the ones of S.K.I.L.L) and if you want to play a Free to Play first person shooter on Steam, you are better of with PlanetSide 2 or even Firefall.

content:
Posted: August 11, 2015
												This free FPS is actually pretty good. Nice graphics and working mechanics makes it a good choice if you're looking for a new game to play.The "P2W" a lot of people complain about is definitely there since VIP status will give you 5% more damage and 5% reduction on recoil on certain weapons. But overall I didn't really notice it and killed many VIPs.You start with a permanent weapon (which require repair, but it is cheap) and you will get in-game currency to get an extra primary or whatever you'd like to buy in the beginning.Game modes are fun and the maps are good. So my experience with the game itself so far is good and I would recommend it because of that. But then I noticed how toxic the community is. If you do not like chats filled with "noob this and noob that" then you might aswell just skip this one. I've been kicked for being too good and kicked for being bad. Sadly this is just how free FPS games are, mostly filled with angry kids and troubled teenagers. I've been playing for 3 hours before I wrote this, but that is enough for me to see how bad this game's community is.

content:
Posted: May 25, 2015
												I have to say that i hate this game after it didnt connect me to my steam account, and im too lazy to start from over.But i still have to reccomend this game. Its not that bad as it looks.Many of you though that this game is insane P2W, actually, it kinda is P2P, if you meet someone who spend a lot of money it doesnt even matter. I did not spent even a cent to this game and im very often on first position in tabThis game is easy tho, weapon recoil is like from CoD so there is no problem to kill someone with double scorpions from one end of map to secondi had, a lot of fun, i met a lot of friends.Also everyone says that comunity in this game is awfull, everyone calls you noob, idiot, PoS, fuc.er etc. but i played a lot of games and i met like 1 guy? thats all.Also there is some big nonsense in this game..im not sure if i should call it nonsense but i saw few ppls just quickscoping tru whole map. Like, im not calling them hackers or something but im just saying that this game got some searious problems sniper rifles :D.After a lot of battles, i met only one hacker (ab wh)..just looking into wall on our spawn and killing everyone on other side of the map, but he got banned(maybe) pretty fast, in like 2 minutes)i usually played TDM than the other mods but they are pretty fun too.One thing that i dont understand is that i find more AI team deathmatch than any other mods(please..tell me why...)Graph. isnt that bad too ;)When i started the game, i was kinda scared to play because i was lvl 1 and everyone was on like 15 lvl or 12 etc. but it doesnt matter, really.. if you played some fps games then you are ready to play.pros-a lot of fun-quickscope MLG 360 get rekt scrub-you can create your own clan for free after you reach needed level- a lot of mods with even more big maps!-pretty amount of weapons-there is actually first person MOBA game mode called hero mode and i had fun while playing it-funny moments ( 360 random shot, random grenade)-feeling badass when you kill few ppls in a row-you can actually mlg with a sniper rifle-mlg-you can open capsules and try to get something cool-translation. It surprised me when i discovered that it have my languagecons-a lot of items are for real money but they are mostly useless-there are few kinds of capsules that you can open, but only one of them are possible to open for game money-its easy to rage-i had few bugs when i tried to connect to a server (not sure if that was my problem)-expensive items for game money-its hard to make money..you get money for lvling up or doing ''achievements'' (killing 75 ppls with sniper rifle etc.)-when you start the game, you are kinda confused what is what in the menu-few bugs-There is a kil-cam that is sooooooooo bad that when someone kills you and then you see the kill cam, it shows you that he was for example, shooting somewhere around you but he headshoted you somehow.- There are three loadouts that you can use. But you cant use more loadouts for same weapon (fe. If i put a sniper rifle in LoadoutA, i cant put in in LoadoutB. I have to replace them)This game is worth a try

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 25, 2015
												Ok to start off I downloaded thsi game for free I believe it is still counted as the infamour free to pay pay to win genere of games.This game has many bits people will like, many guns you can buy, equipment grenades etc. The game feels good controls wise. It has capture, bombing, man hunt TDM and Dm Game modes.Man hunt is interesting because one team is an ALien threat attacking earth (Only 2 maps you can play on) and the other is the earth defence force.Ths sounds fun playing as Earth Defence force alsa at the start of the game unliek say CS:GO or Tactical intervention you dont get a selection of between 5 and 12 weapons. You start off woth an m16 a hand gun and..... thats it. I had to buy an m60 Machine gun and a incendiary grenade using SP points liek Tactical interventions XP points but you need 25,000 for a hand gun 30,000 for a shotgun 25,000 for armour.... and each match you only get 500 sp.... if you win.And teh kick system is awful. If I play tactical intervention and soemone is being a prat t killing afk'ing whatever I can push f3 and choose kick that person for free.... IKR crazy idea its free you are restricted but Tactical Intervention does a good job with allowing people to police it.Skill is a joke because it costs you 300 sp to vote kick someone.... not even kicking them just the vote costs you 300 sp.This game has no story So dont go looking for one.People can sometimes be incredibly easy to kill other times incredibly difficult. The kill actions are basic ragdoll physics but unlike Tactical intervention people dont explode. There are no vehicles except for convoy where a trck full of bullion goes at less than a granny on zimmerframe speed and guess what you have to protect it....This is the most blatant example of free to  play but pay to win. I cannot recoommen this. If you want a free game go see Tactical Intervention for a giggle they give you a choice pay 12,000 xp for a hand gun or pay £1.75 say for it. You can even rent on Tactical intervention. I prefer games to be up front with what things cost.

content:
Posted: August 25, 2015
												Overall, a fairly generic fps in the call of duty style of little aim and lots of running. It features lots of different game modes, some seeming more at home in Garrys Mod, so there's a fair amount of different things to do, although it has no singleplayer/coop element. The balancing is decent, though not great, but the biggets failing of the game is the complete lack of anti-hacking measures, leading to nearly every game featuring one or more hackers. In my opinion, this is completely gamebreaking, and with an unexceptional core gameplay I see no reason to choose this game over another with proper protections and a more sportsmanly playerbase.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 18, 2015
												This is one of the most pay to win games I've ever seen, actually make that THE most pay to win game I've ever seen.spending real money in the game gives you:-More damage-Less recoil-More resitance (armor)-More in-game money (this one is kind of a given)-The ability to purchase scopes and other attachements (A normal player CAN'T buy any sights, supressors or laser sights)As a non payer player, you'll have to grind A LOT, to get any weapons, and the best thing of all is  that you have to repair your weapon from time to time as it gets damaged from being used, wich is the best way of spending your hard gained money, in the past 5 day.On top of that there is NO INGAME REPORT SYSTEM, so you can flame and hack to your hearts content as you are very likely to not be caught. Although it has some fun mods, they don't compensate for the Pay to Win factor of the game (And the sexist one, as in order to be a women you have to pay €50 and it's sexuality)If you want to play the kind that as objective based gameplay, buy CS:GO, if you want to play in more closed maps play CoD (in fact CoD maps have much more verticality and alterbative routes that the ones of S.K.I.L.L) and if you want to play a Free to Play first person shooter on Steam, you are better of with PlanetSide 2 or even Firefall.

content:
Posted: September 16, 2015
												So, S.K.I.L.L this game is fun but there's a few issues with it.1st i can't stress this games ♥♥♥♥♥♥ Pay 2 Win system AKA V.I.P; this system is stupid, if you have it you're OP and the newer players don't have a chance against you. I'm assuming you will be thinking "Oh that's great! I can dominate noobs" but, would you like that? Would you like to be dominated by V.I.PS? Anyway now that's out of the way let's get into the gameplay and such. Okay the gamemodes are pretty fun like a payload type game mode where some people defend and push the truck trying to get it to the end of the map, while the opposing side attempt to steal the gold and win the game. I didn't really pay the other gamemode apart from a search and destroy type mode where 1 team defend a bomb while the other team try to detonate it.I enjoyed this game but it's best with some friends.Personal rating 8/10 good game but i got bored of it rating.Proffesional rating 9/10 a good game with some flawes.Now excuse me while i got drink a Dr Pepper and watch some Zero Punctuation.

content:
Posted: January 10, 2016
												I have recommended this game on the basis they sort everything out in the near future which I don't think they will do as they recently stopped running the servers in Indonesia in early december. Firstly, the community is♥♥♥♥♥♥ If you are good, you are a cheat. If you wear armor you are a tank, if you use a certain gun you are a noob. If you hack, you say you are esl.Before you read below - my KD is 1.6 so when I moan about hackers, it isn't because I am a noob.Secondly, there are so many hackers in this game. You won't very often come across someone with an aimbot but you have so many wallhackers in the game it's unbelievable. Don't get me wrong, if you have headphones and good sound you can hear people from a mile away stomping around like an elephant. But when you're walking and someone is just sat there waiting for you (really somewhere you wouldn't normally wait) then you know whats up. Combined with my SF Asia account I have a lot of hours on this game, it's fun and addictive in the right rooms. People say it's a pay to win game, not really. The game is mainly about headshots, what ever HP you have or armor.. you'll still die if you are hit in the head.Anyways, do more about hackers because you really are not doing fk all about it. Also make windowed mode go down to taskbar and not a 360x140 box.. thank you.

content:
Posted: September 13, 2015
												This is my opinion from the 15 hours i've played. yes its only 15 but its enough to get a rough idea of the game.Pros:- Wide range of weapons- many maps and gamemodes available- keeps people within your kd- doesn't have alot of 10 year olds screaming "im an MLG"Cons:- biggest pay to win FPS game ive ever played/seen- people make 2nd accounts just so they can win in lower tiers- Again. biggest pay to win.- has a few hackers, then again, what game hasn'tConclusiom:its a good free2play but the fact that VIP gives you damage boosts and that all cosmetic items cost virtual currency makes you not really have much of a goal in the game. yes i understand the company has to earn money and i respect that they didn't just spam ads everywhere but its just a bit in my opinion. all in all i Recommend this game to those with a big wallet.

content:
Posted: June 5, 2016
												Played 1 match. And can say few things of all games of that kind and that level of quality i've played before. It is almost same to AVA. But...1. Menu is freaken uncomfortable.2. Hipshot and zoom/aim sight mode doing almost same spray & recoil. That mean that Aim(zoom) on all weps except sniper ones is almost useless function and making this game to look like another Counter Strike type of game.3. Quality of ingame browser/menu: Buttons, functions, pushing em, reacting on player actions looks quiet cheap.4. ... i've played pvp 1 round was nice game, my team won it, i've got few ranks and..... shouldn't there be ingame money rewards for this? Money/cash did not came automatically after round, so my cash stayed 0/0, i dont know what need to do to get them or how much more rounds i need to play to get em, but i dont fkn care. I got used to be rewarded after each round. This is game fail to me.5. I did not found on the screen where is PVE/Zombie missions... i did not payed a lot of attention to it. But anyway such a simple thing should be much simplifyed as hell. I just screwed it up. If i want to spend some money i will do it on some other games but not on this one. This is just not worth.6. Bomb plant mode i've played had 12 rounds, In that kind of game I got used to play not more then 8 rounds. So this is too long.--------------Only few thing that i liked this game is fast killing, fast acting... but i already have that stuff in 10++++ of other games of that kind. Overall... game is not bad but also not good enough to compare it to CS:GO/1.6, Ava, Dirty Bomb or even low quality FPS Warface(in this case the damage register may be better in this game, but i will still choose laggy Warface) People argue about old school FPS game,,, i think there are enough of Counter Strike type games already. And people know titles like CrossFire, Combat Arms, AVA, Black Shot.... etc. This game is similar to them and have the most uncomfortable menu interface functions & settings.Ok ... the only 2 reason i liked this game is U3 Engine. I just love that engine. And this game it is basicly free to play.Overall ... /fingerdown.

content:
Posted: May 20, 2015
												I've played this game before (not on steam) and put some decent hours into it.At the end it's not worth it. Believe me.(Had to play at least 5 minutes on steam to be able to write a review)(I just AFK'd the launcher for 5 minutes because I don't want to play this game ever again in my life)The game actually feels somewhat decent when you play it but it doesn't take long before you are matched against some players with purple shining VIP armor and weapons who are unbelievably bad at the game but still destroy you because they are harder to kill and their guns do more damage. In other words, Pay 2 Win.Also (but like in every game nowadays) cheaters are a problem, it seems like the anti cheat they use is so old or it doesn't even do anything.The competitive side is somewhat okay-ish if you play on ESL. It's not allowed to use VIP items in those matches (afaik) but you will be teamed up with people who are probably going full keen bean mode and will flame you to death if you are not half decent in the game, so have fun with that.Without the pay 2 win VIP items bulshit I would probably recommend this game and rate it even as high as a solid 7/10 for a free shooter. But the P2W just ruins all the fun for people who don't want to throw money at this game.
