content:
Posted: June 9, 2016
												I like this game for many reasons:-The zombie survival coop is not easy even at easy mode (unless you're in 3 or 4).-The hardcore mode is very well done on competitive.-Hexa League and Hexa Glass are ♥♥♥♥ing awesome and funny to play.-Fast Matchmaking and no ping problems at all.-Many game modes,really customizable in the lobby options.I dislike this game for the following reasons:-The not-hardcore mode is too unbalanced,VIP players are hugely advantaged,or simply the ones who shopped a "pro" weapon.-The hardcore mode is difficult to find in the servers,it is about 2% of the overall.-Some cheats somewhere.-Plenty of cheats in Sniper-only mode,I was like "Seriously you killed me across the map through 12 different walls and an entire '600 castle? Come on..".-Key settings are not easy and you can't set "hold-toggle" to crouch.-Achievements missing. Not a main problem but they would be appreciated.I'd recommend to give it a try,I liked it! ^^Simply don't play standard mode if you didn't buy any VIP weapon,you'll simply waste your time.

content:
Posted: November 8, 2015
												heres my opinion of this game.pros:-free to play-fast paced-awesome maps-many gamemodes-good weapons-NOT pay to win. i have had VIP and really, it doesnt make a big difference.-can open cases without real money-good, simple graphics. not too many details like some other games.-good scopes-good playerbase, has competitive pro matches in esl.cons:-takes AGES to open the game-really needs zombies-no weapon trading-no teamspeak (exept chat)something to note:-there are many spawn campers in tdm. it takes time to get use to them. you have spawn protection so its fairly easy to kill at least few of them.-yes, many maps are small but thats how its meant to be, fast paced.-the random spawn in tdm is♥♥♥♥♥♥ so thats why i avoid playing in desert camp or farmhouse. try dam of hangar instead-if you are tired of the noobs, try playing on the alpha servers.conclusion:this is by far my most favourite pc game i have ever played 10/10EDIT: zombie mode is awesome :-)really needs spectating pro matches/go4skill, because without it i feel like a part of the game is missing.

number of helpful: 5 of 11 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 12, 2015
												One of the worst FPS i've ever played... The games weapons aren't balanced in the slightest, as of your first 2 guns the M4A1 and the K2 (i think) they seem ok at first, until you meet people with anything else, who manage to beat you bullet for bullet. The recoil system is pathetic, barely effecting the guns in any way, so you may aswell pick up the highest dps gun available and use it. Also the hit boxes are slightly ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, a random number of bullets will just seem to not connect in any way even though they could be standing still and the previous few did...Then we have the sniper rifles...  Completely awful in their own right, the most overpowered weapons ever imagined for a game, and if that wasn't bad enough, while using a sniper rifle the hit boxes seem to completely distort, shooting someone how you would in any other shooter doesn't work, instead you seem to need to DELIBERATELY MISS to actually hit someone. I only discovered this by watching the killcams, in which people were killing me by shooting 5 ft to the left of me, so i tried this and behold - it worked, at which point God like powers are held, especially since for close range you just no scope and hit practically every time. The graphics themselves aren't too bad, not requiring much of you system to play, feeling on par with Blackwatch but with alot less lag. But finally we have he worst point in the game; the community! I've only played for an hour or so, and have only found 1 person who speaks English, and even they wouldn't talk for God knows what reason. The rest of the players are Russian, and occasionally write a message, but that's it.All in all, this game is a 3/10 and I hope it improves over time to atl east equal COD (as its practically a clone) but i doubt it will. Though without the needed upgrades / changes this game will die within a year at best.

content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
												S.K.I.L.L. - Special Force 2 is like a free CoD or CS, and it's awesome. There's a great shop system, and if you don't have enough money for an item you can get a free trial of it, the average being 7 days. You get a plentiful amount of the standard virtual currency, which is enough if you're grateful for the things you get. This makes it a miracle - a free game that isn't Pay to Win. Sure, you can spend real money on items, but you're never forced to. This is fantastic and it makes the game extremely enjoyable, and you can rack up lots of time on it. I got this game solely to pass the time, but now I'm addicted. Every time I go into my games library, my mouse immediately heads to the game's play button and clicks it. I can't stop it.

content:
Posted: May 27, 2015
												The game offers a huge selection of games modes:- Deathmatch and Team Deathmatch: Everyone knows these modes; however, in SKILL you can also play them in hardcore mode, where a single bullet is more than enough to kill you. It's extremely thrilling, also frustrating sometimes, very skill based and we think it could find its spot in competitions as well.- Survival: Co-op mode where you have to withstand the attacks of insect-like horrifying aliens, Starship Trooper style. A nice break from the competitive game modes.- Defence: Same story, co-op vs AI, but this time you have to defend some kind of nuclear reactor against multiple waves of aliens.- Seizure: Capture the flag style mode.- Escape: A team has to activate some radio stations and escape the area, while the other team tries to kill them before they manage to escape.- Blasting: A team must place the bomb and the opponents have to stop them or defuse the bomb in time. From what we were able to see, this is one of the most played game modes, and it's actually very fun, especially if played with friends.- Party modes: This is where the game tries to offer something truly unique, and manages to do that with some crazy and funny game modes: in Manhunt, one team of players will take the role of the aliens and try to hunt the humans, while the other team will play as the soldiers that have to kill all the aliens. There are three different types of aliens to use, including a kamikaze one which explodes after a sprint. Very fun to play. Glass is probably one of the craziest game modes we've ever seen in an FPS: players are in an arena composed of different floors entirely made of hexagonal glass pieces. You can shoot your enemies or shoot at the glass under their feet to break it and make them fall to the bottom, under which there is just death. Hilarious.Still, I think it's an arcade fps game, so well, you can just have fun with it :DI dont have many H on Steam because i didnt know it was here

content:
Posted: May 27, 2015
												The game offers a huge selection of games modes:- Deathmatch and Team Deathmatch: Everyone knows these modes; however, in SKILL you can also play them in hardcore mode, where a single bullet is more than enough to kill you. It's extremely thrilling, also frustrating sometimes, very skill based and we think it could find its spot in competitions as well.- Survival: Co-op mode where you have to withstand the attacks of insect-like horrifying aliens, Starship Trooper style. A nice break from the competitive game modes.- Defence: Same story, co-op vs AI, but this time you have to defend some kind of nuclear reactor against multiple waves of aliens.- Seizure: Capture the flag style mode.- Escape: A team has to activate some radio stations and escape the area, while the other team tries to kill them before they manage to escape.- Blasting: A team must place the bomb and the opponents have to stop them or defuse the bomb in time. From what we were able to see, this is one of the most played game modes, and it's actually very fun, especially if played with friends.- Party modes: This is where the game tries to offer something truly unique, and manages to do that with some crazy and funny game modes: in Manhunt, one team of players will take the role of the aliens and try to hunt the humans, while the other team will play as the soldiers that have to kill all the aliens. There are three different types of aliens to use, including a kamikaze one which explodes after a sprint. Very fun to play. Glass is probably one of the craziest game modes we've ever seen in an FPS: players are in an arena composed of different floors entirely made of hexagonal glass pieces. You can shoot your enemies or shoot at the glass under their feet to break it and make them fall to the bottom, under which there is just death. Hilarious.Still, I think it's an arcade fps game, so well, you can just have fun with it :DI dont have many H on Steam because i didnt know it was here

content:
Posted: May 29, 2016
												Sorta cheap, f2p mashup of CoD and CS. Kinda fun for a while, though terrible server lag is present at all times. Servers feel like they're at 20tic anyway. Horrible hitboxes, very basic recoil. Low skill ceiling. For a free to play shooter there's not much to complain, it makes for a fun knockoff. Killing your opponent and them killing you at the exact same time happens multiple times every game.  If it wasn't for the server lag it'd be a pretty good game for what it is. Latency is normal (~60ms), it's the constant server-side microstutter that ruins it. Would recommend  over TF2  any time. Obviously much better than  any CoD too. Has nothing on any version of CS though, not even comparable, though it shares some similiarities in certain aspects. Snipers are fun to use. There are some fun maps and unique game modes, and a lot of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ly small maps and unnecessary game modes like the one where you have to shoot ♥♥♥♥ing aliens in a DOTA-like FPS setting. Even though some paid items grant some minor gameplay improvements (like 5% reduced recoil for some gold weapons) it's not Pay2Win at all, if you're any good at shooters you'll ace every game without paying a dime.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 3, 2015
												I think this game is everything a multiplayer fps fan is looking for. The developers really had the common shooter fan in mind, that's for sure. You have the usual rent a gear system, you can make your character look as cool as you want, or if it's goofiness you are looking for, it's in there too. You can buy weapons permanently, if you want to try them out first, you just have to get them from daily rewards, or capsules. Sadly you can't put attachments on your weapons, if you want guns with holo sights, you can to open capsules. There are a lot of game modes besides the usual TDM and bomb planting, like convoy, manhunt, seizure, escape, pve and a lot more. The biggest charm of the game for me is the lack of loading times, the action is almost constant. You get in a room, hit F5, and you are in the game. Also before joining a running game you actually get the scores the two teams are having, so you know, if a game is ending soon. The graphics are pretty, the reload animations are well done, ragdolls look so real. There is killcam, even showing the path of the grenade that killed you. While gun damage is pretty realistic (considering the players have armor on), you can play a less forgiving hardcore mode. if you want to. You can buy countless skins, boosts, premium membership (that gives other players xp, and money boost), equipment for real money, but i think the prices might be a bit high. I can only recommend this game. Reminds me a lot of Call of Duty 4, and that's one of my favorite shooters.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 17, 2015
												I think this game is a solid free to play FPS with addictive gameplay. Easy to login and start playing, but hard to stop, although the netcode could use some attention of the developers (can get a bit laggy at times). Brutal violence (can be turned off) and interesting clan battle system if you want to get a richer teamplay experience. The graphics are allright and I believe it will  run fine on older hardware. I bet it will even run on your toaster...  It has a lot of gamemodes to keep you from boredom (PVE, PVP and even Tower defense). It even has a training mode where you can place your own target dummies. Certainly a must try for the FPS enthousiast. I had some good adrenaline shots during this game while playing clan battles. Mostly when all eyes are on you ;). Good game & Have fun!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 29, 2015
												As an avid player of S.K.I.L.L. - Special Force 2, I can safely announce that this game is truly and incomprehensibly, incredibly,♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ With over three thousand hours on this game (ignore my Steam counter, I had an error with it), I am definitely able to say that it is one of the worst games I have played.Every game you enter is constantly full of hackers playing on their 'j-tagged' consoles, using many hacks and cheats including aimbots, wallhacks, aimhacks, and wallbots. The game is truly in a state of such unplayablity that I struggle to have any fun while playing. The sheer number of Russian and Ukranian players joining my servers with their cheats, screaming "♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥,♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥." truly amazes me. I was in such a state of awe at how the developer team created such a beautifully crafted game to such a standard at which pre-pubescent eleven year olds find the sanctum in to follow their dreams of hacking and crying and screaming.As a professional video game reviewer, I can safely state that this is the greatest game I've ever played, 10/10.P.S. Nice FOV scrubs.

So if you want to play a game that is made by a south korean developer but is F2P, play Counter Strike Nexon, at least in THAT GAME you'll BE able to play the game in North America. content:
Posted: May 29, 2015
												As an avid player of S.K.I.L.L. - Special Force 2, I can safely announce that this game is truly and incomprehensibly, incredibly,♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ With over three thousand hours on this game (ignore my Steam counter, I had an error with it), I am definitely able to say that it is one of the worst games I have played.Every game you enter is constantly full of hackers playing on their 'j-tagged' consoles, using many hacks and cheats including aimbots, wallhacks, aimhacks, and wallbots. The game is truly in a state of such unplayablity that I struggle to have any fun while playing. The sheer number of Russian and Ukranian players joining my servers with their cheats, screaming "♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥,♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥." truly amazes me. I was in such a state of awe at how the developer team created such a beautifully crafted game to such a standard at which pre-pubescent eleven year olds find the sanctum in to follow their dreams of hacking and crying and screaming.As a professional video game reviewer, I can safely state that this is the greatest game I've ever played, 10/10.P.S. Nice FOV scrubs.

content:
Posted: May 19, 2015
												I like it. It's better than most other F2P FPS games. The game uses the durability system instead of timed purchases. It's easy to play, kill-time is quick, each weapon requires practice to get used to, it's like the devs took many of the good elements of the popular FPSs, and put them into this game. It's like Counter-Strike and Call of Duty mixed, in a free package. A lot of fun to play. Great graphics, and runs really well on everything maxed, and I'm using a laptop. Highly recommended.

content:
Posted: December 6, 2016
Pros:Maps are the exact same from Soldier Front 2Has a clan system and buddy systemLooks like Soldier Front 2There's a cat skin for the M1. I guess that's a pro, if you can stand the game long enough to get it.Cons:Is not as good as SF2 was (huge balance problems)Common to have players with 300-400+ ping, which sucks for those who have <100. 400 PING. IN AN FPS.You can get shot through wallsHitboxes are badGot stuck on black screen after "tutorial"Tutorial isn't much of a tutorial, it's more of target practice. Teaches you how to crouch jump, doesn't have you swap between primary/secondary or use grenades.Crouch jumping in this game doesn't work very well. Often times it won't work properly.You cannot use the same weapon in multiple loadouts, which means you must have a separate primary and secondary for each loadout.High ranking players can exploit the lobbies and permanently stay in the newbie channels, giving you little chance to progressHackers/aimbotters are also a problemLobby system doesn't have normal wait/ready time, it will instantly go into a match (no prep time)

content:
Posted: November 7, 2015
												It's ok for your typical Korean F2P shooter fare but with more mainstream graphics and permanent weapons. Plus the starting guns are pretty good making for surprisingly balanced gameplay here. The paid mechanics are a total joke though, first you have to pay for a premium membership and then pay money on top of that to get the cash shop guns, essentially spending money to then spend money. Better off just playing for free as the base guns aren't completely useless.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 27, 2016
												This is another one of those games, where I could play the hell out of it when I was younger but now that I'm older I now see how bad the game truly is.I'm from North America, so when I heard they where going to be adding North American servers, I was pretty pumped because I played this title a good amount a few years back. But now, I can truly see how bad this game is, and I'll never understand how I could have played this game so much in the past.Lets start off with the currency.. If you're a free player, be ready for a grind! You don't earn credits when completing a match, you have to do challenges to get credits. For example, Kill 50 people with an AR, and in return you will get 50 credits (GP). Guns take any where from 10k+. This is just one of the easy challenges, it gets harder and more annoying. So if your not paying, be ready for a grind and most likely you will be using guns / items you don't even like just to earn credits.Although I wouldn't call this game pay to win, it's very close to being very pay to win.Give the game  a shot, but I promise you won't see anything you haven't already seen in these free to play shooters.

content:
Posted: May 22, 2015
												A great game for those who are new to FPS genre.Negatives:i feel like it's actually too easy for me (I'm ranked MG2 in CS:GO), aiming down the sights feels pointless, because the recoil on guns isn't very big, and there's also available some kind of armor, that obviously let's you take more damage, and that's quite annoying. Unfortunately the community seems kind of toxic to me, everyone's insulting each other for no apparent reasons (today i was called "noob" from one guy, who couldn't kill me from the same camping spot 3 rounds in a row :D).Positives:surprisingly this game is good and very solid, haven't noticed that it would be pay to win, but i do think there are some better guns, that you need a lot of money for to buy/rent them, but i consider it as a reward for players who get invested in the game. There are also interesting new game modes, I haven't seen before, and I've played different FPSs for 10 years, but they sure could use some balancing and tweaks.To sum everything up - I like the game, probably because it requires no effort to play from me, unlike Counter Strike, give it a try ;)

content:
Posted: August 16, 2016
												My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

												Alright after playing this game for a few hours i gotta say that i will never recommend something like this ever again.  This Game is a free to paly CoD like shooter that strives to be competitive but will never be.  It runs completely on p2p and even on 50 letency it straight up lags like♥♥♥♥♥♥ if you dont mind lag and dieing for no reason at all then you wont mind this but as a person that know how to play shooters this is infuriating.  This game has horrible coding. rawinput is nowhere to be seen and you will always have ♥♥♥♥♥♥ cheesy control over your aim. Since this is free to play i will completely ignore tha obvious unbalacedness of weapons.The map layouts on many maps is like in cod built to be good at as many modes as possible and this makes search and destroy unplayable.

content:
Posted: June 12, 2015
												This game is okay, graphic wise. Very Modern Warfare 2 like. There's plenty of maps and game modes, which all around work well, and very entertaining for my needs.Pros:- Some people aim like they have a broken arm, so if you're a veteran to CS:GO or others, this game will praise you as the God of aiming.- Not Pay2Win.- No voice communications that include angry russians and yelling japanese guys.- Easy to memorize the maps and alike.- Decent animations.- Typical Free-to-Play homescreen.- Decent gameplay.- Matches are short, so it's easy to just take a match before the thing you've scheduled.Cons:- Bad killcams.- Hitboxes are messed up.- Spread is sometimes crazy on the weapon. - All the cool weapons with gold and flames cost real money.- You frequently join a team, where you do all the work. (For i, for example, just finished a match, where i got 38 kills, and my other mates got nothing near that, so rely on yourself, and not your team partners.)- GRENADES. GRENADES EVERYWHERE.- Oh, and then there's nothing else.OVERALL:A fine and okay-ish polished game. If you're bored, or have nothing to play, and play lots of FPS, and are broke as f@ck, play this game, because it's the thing you're looking for. You liked that Rust map from MW2? Yeah, all maps are almost like that (Size-wise) so it should not be a bother of finding and killing the enemies. Happy playing. ^-^

content:
Posted: June 9, 2015
												First of all I will put the review in 3 parts Game design, Monetization and Performance Game design The game have done many things wrong 1- The maps are numerous but extreemly small, it is not unlickely that you will kill someone right after they spawn as the spawn protection have very limited duration 2- Snipers are too strong as most of the time you will die from one hit while walking does not affect the sniper accuracy at all 3- The game have an aim feature but made it useless by making hipfire almost as accurate and much easier to useMonetization The game have two ways to spend real money in it 1- Buy a VIP account 2- Buy Items and some of those can not be bought with currency earned in game 3- Buy a special weapon paint that allows you to have 5% more damage and 5% less recoil  The VIP account allows you to play in VIP only servers and some game modes are locked to VIP only matches.Performance The published requirments are quite low but I had problems with freezing every once in a while and this thing can break the game if you freeze in front of an enemy which happens alot, I googled it and it seems other people have the same problem, so I put it in the discussions on steam and no body have fix so far.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 5, 2015
												S.K.I.L.L. - Special Force 2 is a first person shooter game that is free to play. Hence the title, it does require skills and talents to be good at this game, the good thing is that this description means no more pay to win content. Another nice feature about this game is it has categorised servers to beginners and specific ones to the professionals following the Kill/Death Ratio (K.D ratio more than 1.2 or has a higher level), which makes this game pretty fair.The combat system fits any players that have already experienced other FPS games before, it has a perfect accuracy from the hip and adjusts even more when using the scope, so if you are players from counter strike, you won't need to worry much about this and can get the gist quite easily (while it's not really realistic on it's system of recoil...). The graphics looks quite realistic and well made, a feature that albeit is an exception but somehow really useful to the players is the ''quickscope'' action of the sniper rifle, which you will eventually discover while playing as a sniper...However, there are quite a few hackers and players with bad reputations (which means players that swear a lot), this damages the quality of this game. Notice that there is a little difference between real professionals and hackers, don't judge them to quickly, before calling them hackers when you see them doing a perfect headshot, you should observe him for a few more kills. Overall, This game is almost a fair game, just lacking some anti-hacking systems, I found this game quite interesting, it's really worth to try as a F2P FPS game.Positive remarks+realistic graphics+combat systems appropriate to either beginners or professionals+specialised servers to beginners+''quickscoping'' system on sniper rifles+no big difference between playing for free or paying+easy to get into the game, not too difficult to playNegative remarks-hackers and unfriendly players-not many presented game modes

Posted: June 25, 2015
												the game is a generic as they come and go, nothing really stands out, the game as a frustrating unlock system for the most part you get enough cash to get any gun you want (go for either K2 or SSG or the ohk sniper rifle) that said the game gets old quick, it feels very very outdated grafics and gameplay wise, hell even cs 1.6 the shooting feels betterthe game is suprisignly bloody, and it does have a good variety of maps but they are all very cramped, you can have some fun with it but you cant really get very skilled at this game because of how stupid accurate the guns are(they could very well be lazer guns) and the skins for the guns are by far one of the ugliest i have ever seen, also looking up info for this game for more indept stats is really hard and i think it might because the game has 2 names for some reason.over all if you have played military shooters before chances are they beat this one by a fair margin, that said this game is a pretty good start for new shooter players because how simple the shooting feels(quite literally point and shoot),if you are willing to something like 10$ on this game you are honestly better off buying CS GO, it looks better and it runs better, and most important IT PLAYS better.TL;DR:it's meh, it not bad, but it's not great either, if you have played other military shooters before forget about this one

content:
Posted: June 28, 2015
												S.K.I.L.L. - Special Force 2 is a valid free-to-play shooter which puts a lot of emphasis on community and clans. Even if it's not the best shooter around regarding graphics and sounds, it manages to offer a complete and fun overall gameplay experience and some pretty unique and fun game modes. With its simple graphics and solid mechanics, combined with a fair in-game shop and a complete clan system, the game has the right tools to offer a nice competitive scene for hardcore players and an enjoyable environment for new players as well.

First things that meets you once you are through the horrible and non-what-so-ever-explanatory excuse for a tutorial? A market place where everything but the two (yes TWO!) basic weapons has to be bought. You can only choose one out of the two starter weapons of course... no need to confuse people. Besides from that, there are bits and pieces where you can brush up on your Russian, because they haven't bothered translating it. 10/10 would uninstall every day of the week.

content:
Posted: June 11, 2016
												Just hit 100 hours of gameplay, Its a great game (especially for a free to play). These are my opinions/reasons:Great Graphics (doesnt need the best pc in the world either) Its not Pay to win (trust me, all the things that cost real money is optional, it doesnt give a huge advantage)Awesome People (we are all friends however that doesnt mean you wont see people saying "Noob" "Knife Noob" (espeically in point/round battle)So many gamemodes (a really cool thing is that in gamemodes like Sniper Point/Round, If you do not have a sniper it will let you use a weapon called "CZ700 (Low rank)" so you dont need any requirements to play sniper, the same with shotgun team death match, you get a weapon to use aswell :DClans (You can join and create clans, cool thing is, when your starting a game it shows the current top 10 clans)and so much more!I dont really have any cons, when i found out about this game i was so amazed and i got addicted to playing it xD all my friends joined and because this game was so good i even bought stuff.I hope this helped!Have a good day!CalloPlayz (You can request me to be friends too :D)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 15, 2016
												A fps for the more casual player. Battlefield-ish. Cheap but all is very logical and easy to get used to. A variety of decent maps. A good selection of modes and weapons. The community is ok. Gameplay-wise it can get quite hectic depending on the map size to player ratio but it's quick entertainment. There is no pay to win element. Or if there is, I didn't experience it. If on one map you encounter ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t players then just pick another one. It's as simple as that. If you have no money and want to play a fps game then look no further. Actually I'd recommend this even if you have tons of money and are looking for a great multiplayer game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 12, 2015
												This game is okay, graphic wise. Very Modern Warfare 2 like. There's plenty of maps and game modes, which all around work well, and very entertaining for my needs.Pros:- Some people aim like they have a broken arm, so if you're a veteran to CS:GO or others, this game will praise you as the God of aiming.- Not Pay2Win.- No voice communications that include angry russians and yelling japanese guys.- Easy to memorize the maps and alike.- Decent animations.- Typical Free-to-Play homescreen.- Decent gameplay.- Matches are short, so it's easy to just take a match before the thing you've scheduled.Cons:- Bad killcams.- Hitboxes are messed up.- Spread is sometimes crazy on the weapon. - All the cool weapons with gold and flames cost real money.- You frequently join a team, where you do all the work. (For i, for example, just finished a match, where i got 38 kills, and my other mates got nothing near that, so rely on yourself, and not your team partners.)- GRENADES. GRENADES EVERYWHERE.- Oh, and then there's nothing else.OVERALL:A fine and okay-ish polished game. If you're bored, or have nothing to play, and play lots of FPS, and are broke as f@ck, play this game, because it's the thing you're looking for. You liked that Rust map from MW2? Yeah, all maps are almost like that (Size-wise) so it should not be a bother of finding and killing the enemies. Happy playing. ^-^

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 24, 2016
												Weeeeeeeeeeeeelllll. The game is I can say one of the best F2P shooters, in and outside of Steam. First of all the Game is F2P which is a big plus... like always.The game tbh is a mix between A.V.A and COD. It has a pool of maps and game modes that are fun. Especially Hexa. You need to try it or at least look it up because its special! I havent seen any pay to win yet. Because if you get OP guns in a low rank and you OWN hard you get moved into lobbies that have a higher KD ratio. So good players and bad player get separated.But like every game there are some cons.. The game isnt tactical at all to be honest. It's to fast paced to be counted as a tactical shooter. Sometimes you have to wait and wait and wait to get into a map or game mode you like.The graphics aren’t high end… but still good looking.. Also the game is an ESL competition. So its sign of a active community.My rating 7(8-ishh...)/10Would play it again :P

												Another totally failed copy from Crossfire Europe.43.9 hours of suffering.This game is a total pay to win game there is no way to get credits, you have to play about 20 matches a day if you are a middle player or if you are a bad player? You will never see a single credit.I wonder why this game is still running the developers just want people to pay their ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game.Liek seriously the bots dont ever miss a single shot even when playing on easy,when they lock at you,you are practicaly dead there is no way they will miss a single shot even if you are spamming the space button and looking like a total retart in game.Oh and I forgot to mention IF you manage to get the credit payment it's such a low ammount that you can not even repair your own guns.The developers are all about the money, they just DONT CARE about the people's enjoyment.What I have to say is DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS GAME it's a waste of 3.1GB and probably 1 hour or 2 of your life, and in the worst case? Losing money for no reason.I personaly hope this game will be never played again.

												If you can live with the dated graphics and UI, It's easily one of the best playing (F2P) shooters with outstanding leveldesign on the objective maps and very satisfying gunplay. Balance seems pretty good and there is no noticeable pay to win. Played it a bunch before the steam version and I've tested basically all existing F2P FPS. The Game is only held back by peer to peer connections and its age. Compared to nearly all other F2P fps, Special force 2 has actually good gameplay.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 15, 2016
												A fps for the more casual player. Battlefield-ish. Cheap but all is very logical and easy to get used to. A variety of decent maps. A good selection of modes and weapons. The community is ok. Gameplay-wise it can get quite hectic depending on the map size to player ratio but it's quick entertainment. There is no pay to win element. Or if there is, I didn't experience it. If on one map you encounter ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t players then just pick another one. It's as simple as that. If you have no money and want to play a fps game then look no further. Actually I'd recommend this even if you have tons of money and are looking for a great multiplayer game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 5, 2015
												S.K.I.L.L. - Special Force 2 is a first person shooter game that is free to play. Hence the title, it does require skills and talents to be good at this game, the good thing is that this description means no more pay to win content. Another nice feature about this game is it has categorised servers to beginners and specific ones to the professionals following the Kill/Death Ratio (K.D ratio more than 1.2 or has a higher level), which makes this game pretty fair.The combat system fits any players that have already experienced other FPS games before, it has a perfect accuracy from the hip and adjusts even more when using the scope, so if you are players from counter strike, you won't need to worry much about this and can get the gist quite easily (while it's not really realistic on it's system of recoil...). The graphics looks quite realistic and well made, a feature that albeit is an exception but somehow really useful to the players is the ''quickscope'' action of the sniper rifle, which you will eventually discover while playing as a sniper...However, there are quite a few hackers and players with bad reputations (which means players that swear a lot), this damages the quality of this game. Notice that there is a little difference between real professionals and hackers, don't judge them to quickly, before calling them hackers when you see them doing a perfect headshot, you should observe him for a few more kills. Overall, This game is almost a fair game, just lacking some anti-hacking systems, I found this game quite interesting, it's really worth to try as a F2P FPS game.Positive remarks+realistic graphics+combat systems appropriate to either beginners or professionals+specialised servers to beginners+''quickscoping'' system on sniper rifles+no big difference between playing for free or paying+easy to get into the game, not too difficult to playNegative remarks-hackers and unfriendly players-not many presented game modes

Posted: August 1, 2016
												Being a glutton for punishment and not being particularly good at FPS, I thought I'd give this one a go as it was free and I had nothing to lose (except some more of my self esteem), but surprisingly enough I seem to be decent enough at it. The game is pretty standard stuff, shoot the people that's not in the same team as you. It has your standard rounds like team deathmatch and quite often (at least in my experience) there are some people willing to help out the newer players. On the negative side there is quite a few people who camp right next to spawn areas and it takes a good few deaths before you turn up in another spawn area where people haven't set a tent with a cup of tea waiting to welcome you with a gun, but overall it's a good time killer and finally an FPS where my kill to death ratio isn't 1:10000* a game.* it's 2:10000

content:
Posted: July 12, 2015
												I can't tell if I like this game or hate it. The movement feels solid, but I don't like how you stop for a second if you change weapons. Also, the crouch-jumpo thing is completely ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and they should really just keep crouch jumping to what it is instead of pressing them both at the same time with the smallest window of opportunity to actually jump a centimetre higher than usual to actually get onto something that you should just be able to normally jump onto. The hitboxes in this game are appalling. Someone can shoot about 3 metres to the left of an enemy and still hit them. The only time the hitboxes actually work is when you're using a sniper rifle, which puts people who like to use snipers at a huge disadvantage in normal game modes. It's a shame, because sniping in this game feels extremely solid and a lot of fun. It really feels rewarding when you get a good kill. If they could improve on the things I've mentioned, then I would definitely play it a lot more.

content:
Posted: June 11, 2016
												Just hit 100 hours of gameplay, Its a great game (especially for a free to play). These are my opinions/reasons:Great Graphics (doesnt need the best pc in the world either) Its not Pay to win (trust me, all the things that cost real money is optional, it doesnt give a huge advantage)Awesome People (we are all friends however that doesnt mean you wont see people saying "Noob" "Knife Noob" (espeically in point/round battle)So many gamemodes (a really cool thing is that in gamemodes like Sniper Point/Round, If you do not have a sniper it will let you use a weapon called "CZ700 (Low rank)" so you dont need any requirements to play sniper, the same with shotgun team death match, you get a weapon to use aswell :DClans (You can join and create clans, cool thing is, when your starting a game it shows the current top 10 clans)and so much more!I dont really have any cons, when i found out about this game i was so amazed and i got addicted to playing it xD all my friends joined and because this game was so good i even bought stuff.I hope this helped!Have a good day!CalloPlayz (You can request me to be friends too :D)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 14, 2016
												I have to be honest, this game was not what I expected. There are many different game types to choose from but only a select few are actually played by the common player. The game (as with many free to play titles) has allot of aesthetic items and skins for guns 90% of which require real money to get,The game has the graphics of a game from 2008 but is a perfect sub for high demanding games, to play S.K.I.L.L you must keep in mind that the learning curve is steep, and the gameplay is similar to how CS:GO would play. Every map is designed with the same characteristics of that of maps from CS:GO, Three central routes with sub routes joining the main ones togeather to make it easier to triverse. Sniping is far than common in multiplayer as the bullet does not need to hit the enemies body but rather near their body to deal damage. Some guns are more overpowered with their stats and general gameplay using them but the creator(s) have a history of not listening to the fans input and have yet to fix any of the key issues the game clearly has. I personally enjoy the game and if you have the patience then I would suggest playing it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 28, 2016
												This game feels a lot like Call of Duty did before it added double jumps. I'll start by saying some good things about this game. The graphics are pretty good, nothing amazing, but the game looks nice enough and runs well. The guns also feel very good and have a nice amount of kick to them, making it very satisfying to get a kill. But i have to give this game a thumbs down as the menus seem like they are taken from CS:NZ, the map design is pretty poor overall, your FOV is massively zoomed in and you can't change it. It is also pretty pay to win from what i've seen as all the guns are stupidly over-priced with in game currency, so basically forcing you to spend money to get good weapons. Even if you buy the good guns though, you'll have to repair them so you can fight against the obvious aimbotters and wallhackers.

												I have played this game for 5 Houres now and i am sick of it! The multiplayer is full of PTW players that have overpowered guns. You have a small start credit and after that you have to do events or just grind very hard to get a FEW coins! At first it seemed fun and all but the PTW just ♥♥♥♥s it up. But i have to say that the AI gamemodes are fun. Just because you can get a few kills without spending money on the game! I totally don't recommend it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 20
												so my review.....mostly bad.so lets starts with the gun fights they are ok they keep you engaged and they can be intense and thats like the only good thing about this game in my opinion. And now the bad thingsits P2W no doubt about it at the start of the game you get given 30k sp (sp is the money) and with it you could buy 1-2 guns depending on the price and then once you get them its hard to get another gun and to get more sp.now hackers. i decided to do this review right after i had the game with the 2 hackers because i had enough of that game and i realised when i went to leave there was a kick option and i clicked on it now 1st of all you could only kick people on your team and the opposite team didnt bother to kick them because they probably enjoyed winning and 2nd of all which blew my mind it COSTED ingame money to kick someone like someone give me a game where it need ingame money to kick someone oh i know S.K.I.L.L special force 2. the game just wants you to buy things.Did i mention you can play it LIKE csgo. You can aim in and such but you dont need to. I was trying to work out if it was better to aim in or not.but altogether i give this game a solid 4/10 the gameplay is good without hackers and withing my 2nd game i found my favourite map which was just a bendy cave or whatever... it was like a tug of war thing pushing or you getting pushed back etc. but thats it i dont think id play this again 4/10 for gameplay (without hackers that say its the killcam when you can see their bullets turn and such.)2/10 for recommendation
